snippet: Before Genevieve Sabourin testified that there had been a romance with Alec Baldwin, she made several outbursts and was ordered to jail for 30 days for contempt of court.
abstract: Genevieve Sabourin, accused of stalking actor Alec Baldwin, testifies in Manhattan Criminal Court; says Baldwin seduced her on romantic New York date in February 2010, then wrote her for months afterward suggesting he cared for her; Sabourin makes several outbursts in court before her testimony and as a result is ordered to jail for 30 days for contempt.
lead_paragraph: Before Genevieve Sabourin testified that there had been a romance with Alec Baldwin, she made several outbursts and was ordered to jail for 30 days for contempt of court.

headline.main: Woman Accused of Stalking Alec Baldwin Takes Stand to Give Her Side
headline.print_headline: Woman Accused of Stalking Alec Baldwin Takes Stand to Give Her Side
